history.heading: Align and expose step and repeat (direct step on wafer) or step and scan (scanner) lithography equipment for wafer processing using photo-optical or X-ray methods and having all of the following:
history.title: Align and expose step and repeat (direct step on wafer) or step and scan (scanner) lithography equipment for wafer processing using photo-optical or X-ray methods and having all of the following:

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 1 to Part 774—The Commerce Control List

breadcrumbs: 3B993 Specified semiconductor manufacturing equipment as follows (see list of items controls).
history.text:
Align and expose step and repeat (direct step on wafer) or step and scan (scanner) lithography equipment for wafer processing using photo-optical or X-ray methods and having all of the following:
[Reserved]
f.1.a. [Reserved]
A light source wavelength equal to or longer than 193 nm and having all of the following:
f.1.b. A light source wavelength equal to or longer than 193 nm and having all of the following:
1 The capability to produce a pattern with a 'Minimum Resolvable Feature size' ('MRF') of 45 nm or less; and
f.1.b.1 The capability to produce a pattern with a 'Minimum Resolvable Feature size' ('MRF') of 45 nm or less; and
A maximum 'dedicated chuck overlay' value greater than 1.50 nm and less than or equal to 2.40 nm.
f.1.b.2. A maximum 'dedicated chuck overlay' value greater than 1.50 nm and less than or equal to 2.40 nm.
Technical Notes for paragraph 3B993.f.1: 1. The 'Minimum Resolvable Feature size' ('MRF') is calculated by the following formula:
where, for the purposes of 3B993.f.1, the K factor = 0.25. 'MRF' is also known as resolution. 2. 'Dedicated chuck overlay' is the alignment accuracy of a new pattern to an existing pattern printed on a wafer by the same lithographic system. 'Dedicated chuck overlay' is also known as single machine overlay.

2. 'Dedicated chuck overlay' is the alignment accuracy of a new pattern to an existing pattern printed on a wafer by the same lithographic system. 'Dedicated chuck overlay' is also known as single machine overlay.
content.text: where, for the purposes of 3B993.f.1, the K factor = 0.25. 'MRF' is also known as resolution. 2. 'Dedicated chuck overlay' is the alignment accuracy of a new pattern to an existing pattern printed on a wafer by the same lithographic system. 'Dedicated chuck overlay' is also known as single machine overlay.
